alternatives.transcript: Across America the way tobacco products are sold and marketed will never be the same the tobacco industry has agreed to remove virtually all Outdoor Advertising they've agreed to ban most tobacco branded merchandise and fund a massive independent education campaign to keep kids from smoking it's all part of the tobacco settlement agreed to by all 50 Attorneys General and the tobacco industry to resolve years of controversy

see and to try to help protect kids now Washington plans to sue the tobacco industry for billions of dollars more and use federal courts and prosecutors to do the job of Congress and elected officials shouldn't the government at least give the state settlement a chance to work before starting a federal lawsuit call your member of Congress at 200 to 225 3121 give the state's tobacco settlement a chance to work

last November Attorneys General from 50 states reach settlements to ban Billboards get rid of most tobacco branded merchandise and pay for independent advertising campaigns to try to convince kids not to smoke but Washington won't even give the state's element time to work they plan to sue the tobacco companies using the courts to do congress's job that's not just unfair
and politically motivated it's really just a backdoor way to raise taxes the American people know better they know the federal lawsuit is about money you are money
call your member of Congress at 200 to 225 3121 tell them to let the state's element work and stop wasting more money on a political lawsuit

should the federal government sued the tobacco industry in 1997 the United States Attorney General said the federal government doesn't have an independent case against the industry but now the federal government has hired outside trial lawyers to see if they can make up a case why try one word money the federal government went so overboard last year in trying to raise tobacco taxes that the states had to make a separate agreement with the industry a separate settlement with the industry that severely

restricts advertising and marketing of tobacco products and pays for independent anti-smoking campaigns some officials of the Federal Government tried to get part of the state's money but Congress wouldn't let them so now the federal government wants to cook up some reason to sue anything to get their hands on more money call your member of Congress at 200 to 225 3121 tell them to let the state settlement work and stop wasting more money on a political lawsuit

the tobacco companies are up to their old tricks they're running TV commercials saying the justice department suit against them is unfair and trying to make themselves look like innocent victims I don't know about you but I'm not falling for it they lied to us before and they're lying to us again they said they didn't Target kids in their advertising but they produced advertising messages featuring cartoon characters and watched three thousand kids A Day become regular smokers

they denied that cigarette smoking causes cancer and other fatal diseases while an avalanche of scientific evidence proved otherwise to this day they won't admit that nicotine is addictive meanwhile over a million kids a year get hooked on it I have kids myself and I'm not going to sit idly by and watch them become victims of the tobacco companies our children need our help the government wants to provide it isn't that their job

they've earned billions of dollars on the sale of tobacco they've distributed cigarettes to soldiers for free they've supported tobacco Farmers for decades they've warned about the risks of smoking for 30 years who we talking about no not the tobacco companies the federal government and now they want to spend millions of taxpayer dollars trying to develop a legal basis for yet another lawsuit against tobacco companies before

for the settlement with all the states has even had a chance to work the federal government has required warning labels on tobacco products for over 30 years and now they suggest they didn't know smokers can also get sick as an excuse to file a lawsuit to federal state and local governments combined earned four times more on a pack of cigarettes than the tobacco companies themselves and now they want even more any lawsuit would be unfounded and hypocritical

there a problem officer imagine if a legal product such as the car you drive was suddenly outlawed because someone decided it was bad for you sir this Vehicles been classified a public safety hazard by the federal government that's what the federal government is now doing two cigarettes acting like it's a crime to manufacture and Market tobacco products in fact right now they're planning to try to sue tobacco companies virtually out of business and

those spending Millions just to drum up a legal basis for the suit litigating this case would cost taxpayers many millions more if they can do this to the tobacco companies today they can do it to other legal businesses tomorrow hey Frank look here don't you know the federal government is classified french fries as a public health hazard it's a dangerous precedent that could lead to higher prices on products the government targets as Politically Incorrect

the trial lawyers are having a feast they've already made hundreds of Millions on the state settlement with the tobacco companies but they're hungry for more and guess who's picking up the tab you the taxpayers that's because the federal government wants to bring still another lawsuit against tobacco companies before the state settlement has even had a chance to work after the professional attorneys in the Department of Justice concluded that the government has no

no independent legal case against the tobacco industry the government decided to end run its own experts and now they're spending millions of taxpayer dollars to hire a group of private trial lawyers to concoct a basis for the suit if trial lawyers are paid to find a reason to litigate you can bet they'll find one and millions upon millions of your tax dollars will be spent on a phony Federal lawsuit don't let the trial lawyers get fat at your expense

does one arm of the government know what the other arm is doing in 1997 the secretary of the Department of Veteran Affairs said it was absurd for the federal government to pay the health care costs of veterans with smoking-related diseases he said smoking was a matter of personal choice now the Department of Justice says it wants to do exactly what the VA department said is absurd even though two years ago the Attorney General said the federal government doesn't have

have an independent case against the tobacco industry the government is even spending millions of taxpayer dollars to hire a group of private trial lawyers to concoct a basis for the suit can these guys get their story straight why should the tobacco industry be held liable for something the government has said is absurd why is a government lawsuit the answer to something that is really about personal choice and individual responsibility call your member of Congress at 20 to 22
I believe in hard work that's the way I was brought up family's been working in tobacco industry's long as we can remember that's how I earn my living provided for the kids

never thought I'd be punching out for the last time see all those lawsuits against the tobacco companies cost some money lots of it cost me my job lots of other fellows to one thing my mom always taught me was people ought to be responsible for what they do can't go looking to blame somebody else for your own actions
but that's what's happening now
I want somebody else to pay the price right now
looks like that's me
maybe tomorrow it'll be you call your member of Congress at 200 to 225 3121 and stop the federal government from suing people out of their jobs
